alert.note: Alert for Elbert; Franklin; Hart (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 26 at 10:49PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Franklin, northwestern Elbert, Hart, southwestern Anderson, west central Abbeville and southeastern Oconee Counties through 1130 PM EDT... At 1049 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 4 miles southeast of Carnesville, or near Victoria Bryant State Park, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Hartwell, Carnesville, Homeland Park, Royston, Reed Creek, Lavonia, Gumlog, Iva, Bowman and Lake Secession. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
